original_title: Sri Lanka President proposes to develop Kandy into planned city
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet has approved a proposal by President Ranil Wickremesinghe to develop Kandy with better infrastructure and services, his office said in a statement.

A committee made up of the Urban   Development Authority, the Kandy District Development Committee,   parliamentarians and ministers representing the district, and experts  in city planning will prepare the  development plan.
The cabinet of ministers had approved the proposal after meeting in Kandy.
The urban plan for Senkadagala, the historic name for the hill city, will cover Katugastota, Kandy and Kundasale areas.
The government will accelerate the Central   Expressway project that will connect Kandy with Katugastota, the statement said.
Sri Lanka has halted several capital projects to cut spending and is waiting for the approval of an International Monetary Fund program to re-structure debt. (Colombo/Feb20/2023)
